intro: Haplophyllum villosum subsp. leiocarpum, commonly known as the silky-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, often glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is known for its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. The subspecies leiocarpum is distinguished by its more densely hairy leaves compared to other subspecies of Haplophyllum villosum.
